alert.note: Alert for Dodge (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 24 at 4:31PM CDT until July 24 at 5:15PM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM CDT FOR DODGE COUNTY... At 431 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 7 miles north of Claremont, or 9 miles northeast of Owatonna, moving south at 25 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe storm will be near... Claremont around 445 PM CDT. Blooming Prairie around 520 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include County Roads 20 And 5, Concord, Eden, County Roads 5 And 6, Wasioja, Highway 56 And County 6 and Graves Landing Field. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
